meanings.definition: To send or direct (something) to the wrong place.
meanings.sent1: The mail carrier accidentally misrouted the package to the neighbor's house.
meanings.sent2: I misrouted the letter to the old address instead of the new one.
meanings.sent3: The misrouted package ended up in the wrong hands, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her misrouted directions led her to a deserted road in the middle of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The misrouted package took a detour around the city before finally reaching its destination.

meanings.definition: To send (someone or something) by the wrong route.
meanings.sent1: The GPS misrouted us through a construction zone, adding extra time to our journey.
meanings.sent2: The airline misrouted my luggage to a different airport.
meanings.sent3: The misrouted bus tour accidentally ended up at the amusement park instead of the museum.
meanings.sent4: Her misrouted hike took her through the dense forest instead of the marked trail.
meanings.sent5: The misrouted delivery truck got stuck in a narrow alley, unable to turn around.
